summary: REQ-1 (adding Ronaldo/goal/ball static images and updating MiniGameCuteFootball to display them across idle/kick/goal/miss states) is not evidenced in the diff: no new image assets were added, and the visible MiniGameCuteFootball changes focus on power-meter/difficulty timing logic rather than rendering the specified images. The diff also introduces unrequested gameplay tuning changes and additional global styling changes.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the five specified static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and update MiniGameCuteFootball to display Ronaldo kicking + goalpost + ball during idle/aiming, show a kick moment on "Kick!", and show distinct goal vs miss visuals using the new images.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows no added files (so the required PNG assets are not added), and the truncated MiniGameCuteFootball snippet contains state/timing logic but no evidence of referencing or rendering the specified image filenames or paths for idle/kick/goal/miss visual states.

hallucinated_features.description: Gameplay/difficulty tuning changes to Cute Football (sweet spot range, meter interval, meter step).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals explicitly prohibit changing difficulty tuning constants or win/lose conditions beyond what is necessary to render new images; the diff directly changes these constants.
evidence: frontend/src/game/screens/MiniGameCuteFootball.tsx (truncated): "const SWEET_SPOT_MIN = 30; // Easier: was 40", "const SWEET_SPOT_MAX = 85; // Easier: was 80", "const METER_INTERVAL = 40; // Slower: was 30", "const METER_STEP = 2; // Slower: was 3"

hallucinated_features.description: Global styling/theme additions and new animation utilities (including ball-flight) in index.css.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1, which focuses on adding static images and updating the mini-game UI visuals; global theme refactors/extra animations are not evidenced as necessary to render the new static images.
evidence: frontend/src/index.css: large theme variable changes and added utilities including "@keyframes ball-flight" and ".ball-flight"

hallucinated_features.description: Project metadata/state update marking new feature requests in project_state.json.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not part of the BuildRequest requirements for implementing image assets/UI behavior; appears as internal tracking rather than requested functionality.
evidence: project_state.json: adds/updates "new_feature_requests" entries AR-1 and AR-2 referencing REQ-1
